website_summaries.verdict: While not the pinnacle of gaming mice, Logitech's MX510 Performance Optical will benefit all but the most competitive digital warrior.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite mouse on the planet!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brand of mouse when they released many, many, many years ago. It finally started to fade with a break in the cable and the mouse wheel starting to not work. I saw this mouse on Amazon used. The price was right. I had to have it. Nothing compares to this particular model for me. The seller delivered the mouse perfectly and I have been using it since. I love this mouse. I don't love many inanimate objects!
customer_reviews.author: user77

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse!
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech MX 510 es a great mouse, not only for gaming but for everyday use too, it's very comfortable and the buttons are in the righ place. It's compatible with Mac OS X and with Windows XP and the drivers for the mouse are optional for user who wants to program the extra buttons, a must! Pros: +Comfortable Mouse +Extra Buttons (programables) +Nice Colors +Very good trackin optical laser Cons: -No as cheap as similar mouses -Some buttons are not so usefull
customer_reviews.author: Alberto

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate Gamers Mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Not only does this mouse look good it performs! I had a lot of problems with my previous mice on Windows XP. They would hesitate too much or suddenly jump off the screen out of view for no reason at all, this is very annoying, especially when playing games. This mouse has been perfect from the day I bought it. It has never acted up like the other mice I tried. Its response time is amazing, no hesitation at all. And the screen jumping thing is nonexistant. I love it so much I have bought it for several people as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Hyper fast response times and extra buttons make it awesome
customer_reviews.text: First tried the Diamondback Game Mouse, which had problems being detected on startup due to it having an excessively high current demand when first plugged in. I returned the Diamondback Game Mouse and bought the MX510, which has worked perfectly from day one. This bad boy has the fast response times that demanding gamers require and the extra buttons allow you to play more efficiently which translates into better scores. I would buy this one again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Great performance! Works on surfaces where other optical mouses can't. I think it's very close to laser quality on this aspect. A little bit bigger than a regular sized mouse. Very comfortable grip and handle. Easy access to roller and buttons (including side buttons). Very convenient and far more cheaper than Logitech G5 and up. Very good quality product with a nice rubber and, metal like, plastic body. Optional USB or PS/2 interface is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Edgardo Pichardo

customer_reviews.title: One of the best mice i've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: One of the best mice i've ever owned. It does get dirty and wears down over time and there are better mice today (2014 ,better feel, more responsive, better material) but in the MX-510's hayday there were no better mouse around.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Leung

customer_reviews.title: Love it so much I  bought a second one!!!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new mouse for CAD work, a friend recommended the Logitech MX 510, and I just loved it. Very sensitive and excellent for "windowing" and "snaping objects" in AutoCAD drawings. I bought a second one for my home computer. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Solorzano

customer_reviews.title: Most reliable mouse I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse back in 2004 and it still works absolutely perfect today.
customer_reviews.author: Tom G.

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse of its kind
customer_reviews.text: I've used several optical mice over the years, and this one beats them all. The buttons are all programmable and while the software doesn't let you configure the buttons/acceleration/speed to the extent that Kensington does, the shape of the mouse is very comfortable (for righties only). If you want a symmetric mouse or more programmability try Kensington's mice.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you so much, this mouse is very comfortable to use and has great features at the touch of your finger without haveing to use the keyboard. I am a mouser!
customer_reviews.author: Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Broken mouse
customer_reviews.text: Its really slow its like broken, stop sell this unused mouse
customer_reviews.author: Lucky wijaya

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Mouse
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is awesome. Lots of programmable buttons, detects fast movements without skipping or popping. One thing I really like about this mouse is that it's very light. I had an older optical mouse (2 years) and also a wireless mouse, both are substantally heavier and much harder to game with. Overall its an awesome device!!
customer_reviews.author: Xulu

customer_reviews.title: Best Mouse I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the MX510, if you use a large high-res screen, it makes all the difference in how far you have to move the mouse. MS Explorer mice cranked all the way up don't even come close. Also highly recommended for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: S. Kaintz

customer_reviews.title: Amazing mouse !!!!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is spetacular, the best mouse i've ever had !!!! Great for gaming Highlly recomended
customer_reviews.author: Rogerio S. de Mattos

customer_reviews.title: and it's not like it even matters
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why I all of a sudden felt the need to review this, and it's not like it even matters. Just got a new gaming desktop, but have been out of gaming for many years. I see deals pop up for new gaming mice, but I could never part ways with this thing. I've had it for 13 years and it's the best darn mouse I've ever used. I wish I could still find one new for the day this one finally gives up on me.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: This model is ancient
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these MX510s back in 2003 for under fifty dollars. This is shady.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: certainly the best mouse in the world for its durability and overall ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first ever mx510 back in 2004 - that was the only time I had to buy mx510 because after that till now its still there for me... certainly the best mouse in the world for its durability and overall performance, mx518 comes close but this baby is the best... Logic pls make these again...mine got damaged in my luggage in the plane :( after 9 years....
customer_reviews.author: Omer Masood

customer_reviews.title: MX510 is a Legendary Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Like others I bought this mouse when it was first released back in 2004. Unfortunately I've just replaced it due to the left click button failing. Not that I'm complaining, it's 7 years old! I'm just bummed I cannot get this exact model again. Being that this mouse served me so well it was a no brainier that I would support Logitech again by buying their great products. I have just replaced it with Logitech G400 which is pretty similar to what I had. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: JKB0076

customer_reviews.title: I bought mine in 2005 and I'm still using it ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine in 2005 and I'm still using it. Playing Battlefield one and H1Z1 KOTK with this mouse. This thing is not a mouse, it's a freaking tank!
customer_reviews.author: Angelo Tiu

customer_reviews.title: Superb mouse
customer_reviews.text: Have had this mouse for about 2-3 years now... some of the spaces between the blue area and the side of the mouse have got gunk in them and some of the logitech label has worn off, but it is functionally perfect. The shape is very ergonomic and comfortable and it has the basic buttons plus a few. The software isn't the greatest (like most bundled driver software) - I use USB overdrive instead, since I'm on a mac. Overall it has been a great and dependable mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Migl

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse -- Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: The mouse is great. The cruise scrolling is an excellent feature. I had to return my first mouse due to a scroll wheel problem, and Logitech shipped me a new mouse with no problems. Very satisfied. I also bought the fUnc sUrface 1030 mouse pad to go along with this mouse and recommend it as well. By the way, I'm a professional computer programmer and spend hours a day on the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Lantana Al

customer_reviews.title: No durability
customer_reviews.text: I own both the mx518 and the mx1000. While I otherwise like the design and performance, on every single mouse on both models, the left click button will fail, either gradually or suddenly. I game heavily so I really work that button. I have swapped out several times on both models with the same result. Within 60 to 90 days, the left click button will fail. Be forewarned about this aspect.
customer_reviews.author: anime watcher

customer_reviews.title: Best Gaming Mouse I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: Whether it's Far Cry or Doom 3 this mouse has been flawless for me. This thing is smooth and dead-on accurate. I consider this a must have for any FPS player. I can't even begin to explain how much better a player I am with this mouse. Accuracy and confidence are overflowing now! It's also a great looking mouse. It has a very cool pseudo-marble finish. Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: ASP

customer_reviews.title: Best Mouse Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mouse in 2004 and it's still going strong. Only problem is that a few months ago mousewheel upscroll isn't working as well as it used to. I'm going to replace it with the same model soon. mx510 FOR LIFE!
customer_reviews.author: Sweg

customer_reviews.title: short-lived
customer_reviews.text: Fine while it lasted; after about 6 months, it was erratic, the light not staying on - or sometimes it would, no rhyme nor reason.
customer_reviews.author: BetsyR

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is nice. It tracks very smoothly, and it conforms perfectly to my hand. The color is a little weird, but it looks okay. I bought it because I got sick of using Apple's one button mouse and my bluetooth mouse was unreliable for certain activities like games. I am using this mouse with Mac OS X 10.4 and currently have the extra buttons set to control Dashboard and Exposé. I am very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Not a mouseman shape but close.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the Mouseman wheel with my old computer and was disappointed I couldn't get the same shape in the current offerings. However, the MX 510 is pretty darn close and I am enjoying using it although I don't use all the bells & whistles.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald F. May

customer_reviews.title: Nice Mice
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is one of the best I've used in terms of comfortability and sensitivity. I didn't install the drivers on the CD (I really don't like having another driver eat up RAM), but the mouse worked flawlessly upon plugging it in a Windows XP box. The only problem I see is the slightly uneven mouse feet at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Trent Buckingham

customer_reviews.title: My Mouse Review
customer_reviews.text: Great mouse. After having this mouse for a few years the feet wore away. now the plastic starts to scuff the table. But it still works perfectly. All in all this has proven to be a very good mouse with no complaints other than the issue above.
customer_reviews.author: P. Clancy

customer_reviews.title: Works great with an iMac
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my iMac. Setup and configuration is very easy. If you play online games, your life will completely change once you use this vs. the standard Apple 1 button mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Bevi Locale

customer_reviews.title: quite good overall.
customer_reviews.text: This stylish mouse is as good as MX 700 except it is not wireless. However, the software does not allow us to self-define the buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Hongying Zhao

customer_reviews.title: total satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: One of the better models in the Logitech range. Comfortable palm rest, smooth scroll wheel, and looks pretty in blue. Great mouse for game lovers. Definite 'YES' for users who work simultaneously on 3 or more applications.
customer_reviews.author: Ibrahim Baig Mirza

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse!!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse really is amazing, the only con is that i wish they would have gotten better mousefeet. They are good but could have been better for the price.
customer_reviews.author: joe

product_meta.title: Logitech MX510 Gaming Performance Mouse 931162-0403
product_meta.description: Logitech MX 510 Performance Optical Gaming Mouse - Blue
feature_bullets: Smooth scroll wheel based on optics
Instant setup -- no software drivers necessary

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars61 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
